title: Phase 10: Node Version Constraint Review
description:
Node Version Constraint Review - Risk: Low

Rationale: After all dependencies upgraded, check if we can require a newer Node version.

Steps: Check minimum Node requirements of all packages (check pnpm-lock.yaml), consider bumping engines.node from ^18.0.0 to ^18.17.0 or ^20.0.0, update package.json, pnpm install and full test on target Node version, commit.

Rollback if: Incompatibility with target Node version

title: Phase 7: React Dependents (Radix UI, react-day-picker)
description:
React Dependents (Radix UI, react-day-picker) - Risk: Medium

Rationale: Depend on React. After React upgraded, upgrade all React-dependent utilities together.

Packages: react-day-picker ^8.8.0 → ^8.latest, @react-hookz/web ^23.1.0 → ^24.latest, @tanstack/react-table ^8.9.3 → ^8.latest, all @radix-ui/* packages (v1.x or v2.x)

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint && pnpm build, thorough manual testing with pnpm dev (test all Radix components, interactions, responsive design), commit.

Rollback if: Type errors, component API changes, visual regressions

title: Phase 4: ESLint & Prettier
description:
Build Tools - ESLint & Prettier - Risk: Low

Rationale: Pure dev tools affecting code quality checks and formatting only.

Updates: eslint ^8.46.0 → ^8.latest, @typescript-eslint/* ^5.62.0 → ^6.latest, eslint-config-prettier ^8.9.0 → ^9.latest, prettier ^2.8.8 → ^3.latest

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm lint --fix, pnpm format:write, pnpm typecheck && pnpm build, commit.

Rollback if: Excessive new lint violations or formatting conflicts

title: Phase 6: React Core (18.x)
description:
React Core - Risk: Medium

Rationale: Foundation framework. Must upgrade before React-dependent packages. Safe to go to latest 18.x.

Packages: react ^18.2.0 → ^18.latest, react-dom ^18.2.0 → ^18.latest

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint && pnpm build, test with pnpm dev for hydration issues and console errors, commit.

Rollback if: Hydration errors, type mismatches, or rendering issues

title: Phase 9: Next.js Dependents & Redux
description:
Next.js Dependents & Redux - Risk: Medium

Rationale: Depend on Next.js and/or Redux. Upgrade after core frameworks are stable.

Packages: next-redux-wrapper ^8.1.0 → ^8.latest, next-themes ^0.2.1 → ^0.latest, @reduxjs/toolkit ^1.9.5 → ^1.latest, redux ^4.2.1 → ^4.latest, react-redux ^8.1.2 → ^8.latest, @types/react-redux ^7.1.34 → ^7.latest

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint && pnpm build, manual testing with pnpm dev (navigate app, verify state updates, check Redux DevTools, verify theme switching, hydration), commit.

Rollback if: State management breaks, hydration errors, type mismatches

title: Phase 8: Next.js Core
description:
Next.js Core - Risk: Medium

Rationale: Core framework. Must upgrade after React since it depends on React versions.

Packages: next ^13.4.12 → ^13.latest (or 14.x if confident)

Steps: Update version, pnpm install, rm -rf .next, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint, pnpm build, test with pnpm dev (verify all page routes, check deprecation warnings, test API routes), commit.

Rollback if: Build failures, routing issues, runtime errors

title: Phase 5: Tailwind CSS & Styling Utilities
description:
Tailwind CSS & Styling Utilities - Risk: Low

Rationale: Isolated utilities. No other packages depend on them. Upgrade all styling utilities together.

Packages: tailwindcss ^3.3.3 → ^3.latest, tailwindcss-animate ^1.0.6 → ^1.latest, tailwind-merge ^1.14.0 → ^1.latest, class-variance-authority ^0.6.1 → ^0.7.x

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm lint, pnpm build, visual testing with pnpm dev, commit.

Rollback if: CSS generation issues or styling regressions

title: Upgrade all dependencies to latest stable versions
description:
Comprehensive dependency upgrade plan using dependency isolation strategy.

Phases: 
1. Completely Independent Utilities (✓ COMPLETE)
2. State Utilities (immer, use-immer)
3. TypeScript build tool
4. ESLint & Prettier
5. Tailwind CSS & Styling Utilities
6. React Core (18.x)
7. React Dependents (Radix UI, react-day-picker)
8. Next.js Core
9. Next.js Dependents & Redux
10. Node Version Constraint Review

Strategy: Upgrade packages in order of independence, not category. If a phase breaks, nothing that depends on it in later phases has been upgraded yet.

Testing: Each phase requires pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint, pnpm build, and manual pnpm dev testing.

Rollback: git diff HEAD~1, identify failure, quick fix or git reset --hard HEAD~1 to revert phase.

title: Phase 2: State Utilities (immer, use-immer)
description:
State Utilities (Completely Isolated) - Risk: Very Low

Packages: immer (^10.0.2), use-immer (^0.9.0)

Rationale: These have no dependents in the project and don't depend on core frameworks.

Steps: Update versions, pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint && pnpm build, manual testing with pnpm dev, commit.

Rollback if: Type errors or state mutation issues

title: Phase 1: Completely Independent Utilities
description: date-fns, clsx, cmdk, lucide-react, sharp, type-fest, react-circular-progressbar, @vercel/analytics - All upgraded to latest. Status: COMPLETE

title: Phase 3: TypeScript build tool
description:
Build Tools - TypeScript - Risk: Low

Rationale: TypeScript is a dev tool. Affects type checking and compilation, not runtime. Update to latest 5.x.

Steps: Update typescript: ~5.0.4 → ~5.2.2, pnpm install, pnpm typecheck, pnpm lint && pnpm build, commit.

Rollback if: New type errors that require refactoring
